availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Newcomb (Taylor County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah E. Odawalt Newcomb. Father of Sarah L. Newcomb. Farmer in Taylor County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Taylor County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Taylor County in 1862. Served in the 27th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from March 21, 1862. Died of heart disease while in military service in Louisville Hospital on November 8, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, District 1, p. 164B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, p. 558.

"John Gary 'McGary' Newcomb" (1824-1862)," Find A Grave, Memorial #84363858, accessed January 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84363858.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994058, Taylor County Births.
Registers of Death of Volunteers, 1861-1865, NARA RG 94, Vol. 15 Kentucky L-Z, p. 49.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 248-49.
